inclusion.criterion: All outpatients admitted to the emergency ward for suspected pulmonary embolism defined as acute onset of new or worsening shortness of breath or chest pain without another obvious etiology will be included in the study, provided they correspond to the following
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: PE suspicion raised more than 24 hours after admission to the hospital
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients anticoagulated for a disease other than venous thromboembolism (for instance, atrial fibrillation)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 55 year old man with lower urinary tract symptoms. Further evaluation revealed IPSS score : 15, Post-void residual: 70 mL, Prostate volume (TRUS): 60 mL, Prostate-specific antigen (PSA) level: 3.2 ng/mL, and maximum flow rate when urine volume was 130 mL.
